class Solution(object):
    def findMaximumLength(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: int
        """
        # Edge case: If the array is already non-decreasing, return its length
        if all(nums[i] <= nums[i+1] for i in range(len(nums)-1)):
            return len(nums)
        
        # For any other case, the answer would be at most the length of the array minus 1
        # because we can always select a subarray of length n-1 and replace it with its sum,
        # leaving one number out to ensure the array is non-decreasing if possible.
        # However, if the array is strictly decreasing, the best we can do is replace the entire
        # array with the sum of its elements, resulting in an array of length 1.
        return min(len(nums), 2) if len(nums) > 1 else 1
